sense.name: show preference for, bestow preferential treatment
sense.examples: He favored loud suits and coloful ties. We favor our local team. Voters favored reform. She favors wine over beer. He always felt that his parents favored his younger brother. They favored him with the best seat in the house. This tax cut only favors the rich. She favored the chivalrous knight with a single chase kiss. Will you favor me with a smile? The darkness favored their escape. A strong wind will favor the bigger boats.

sense.name: treat or use something gently
sense.examples: He limped across the room, favoring a bad knee. He favored his wounded shoulder as he wiped the last of the orc blood off his sword.

sense.name: resemble somebody
sense.examples: She favors our Great Aunt Matilde. He and his father favor.
